options.name: Apprentice Smith
options.description: You have learned the fundamentals of metalworking and fabrication. Gain +1 skill with fabrication.

options.name: Metallurgy
options.description: You have studied metals and their properties. You gain +1 academics and roll a bonus dice when making checks that identify rocks, minerals or metal. Additionally, when you fail fabricating a weapon or piece of armor, you can spend an hour to recover any ingots you used.

options.name: Scrapyard Smith
options.description: You have talent with making more with less. You gain +1 logic and do not suffer the first-time craft penalty for a recipe you have never made before. Additionally, you can spend 4 hours smelting down a weapon or piece of armor and recover ingots from it.

options.name: Reaction : Brace
options.description: In response to making a deflection check or a check to avoid being displaced, roll an additionally fabrication check with a single dice, adding it to the original check.

options.name: Forge Labor
options.description: Working near a forge has strengthened your body and made you more tolerant of heat. Gain +1 skill with fitness and +1 heat mitigation.

options.name: Hammer Strokes
options.description: You can swing a club as naturally as you swing your smithing hammer. Gain +1 skill with simple melee weapons and +1 skill with might.

options.name: Master Craftsman
options.description: Your fabrication skills have reached professional levels. Gain +1 skill with fabrication. When making fabrication checks, any roll under a 4 becomes a 3.

options.name: Improved Weapons
options.description: You have focused on crafting superior arms. Weapons you fabricate gain an extra module slot.

options.name: Improved Armor
options.description: You have focused on crafting superior armor. Armor you fabricate gains an extra module slot.

options.name: Legendary Artisan
options.description: You have achieved mastery over your craft. Gain +1 talent and +1 skill with fabrication. When making fabrication checks, any roll under a 6 becomes a 5.
